title: Ticket #4646: DaemonCore::Create_Process() PID collision code core dumps?
description:
LIGO just had a schedd core dump. This happened in the code that deals with PID collisions, which seems to be pretty infrequently exercised. I haven't verified so far whether you get a core dump every time you hit that code.

Anhow, here's the core dump: 

  10/09/14 03:26:32 (pid:3350) Started shadow for job 5352589.388 on
    slot2@node343.cluster.ldas.cit <10.14.2.93:40991> for archis,
    (shadow pid = 9847)
  10/09/14 03:26:32 (pid:3350) Starting add_shadow_birthdate(5352589.394)
  10/09/14 03:26:32 (pid:3350) Create_Process(/usr/sbin/condor_shadow):
    child failed because PID 9848 is still in use by DaemonCore
  Stack dump for process 3350 at timestamp 1412850392 (14 frames)

    [0x7fcd5c91d970]

    [0x7fcd5c917707]

    (_ZN12TimerManager7TimeoutEPiPd+0x1a1)[0x7fcd5c921e51]
  /usr/lib64/condor/libcondor_utils_8_2_2.so
    (_ZN10DaemonCore6DriverEv+0xbf7)[0x7fcd5c909217]

    (_Z7dc_mainiPPc+0x1799)[0x7fcd5c91faf9]
  /lib64/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xfd)[0x3f0f01ed5d]
  condor_schedd[0x41b229]

Interestingly, this is the last previous reference to that PID: 

  10/08/14 17:52:05 (pid:3350) Started shadow for job 5352371.0 on
    slot1@node391.cluster.ldas.cit <10.14.2.141:43119> for sano,
    (shadow pid = 9848)

(Nothing about the job exiting.)
remarks:
2014-Oct-10 16:38:25 by wenger:
From the relevant SchedLog: 

  10/08/14 08:31:07 (pid:3350) ** $CondorVersion: 8.2.2 Aug 07 2014
    BuildID:265643 $
  10/08/14 08:31:07 (pid:3350) ** $CondorPlatform: x86_64_RedHat6 $

2014-Oct-10 17:08:45 by tannenba:
Looks like this bug appeared starting in v8.1.6 in commit [38724] as part of the IPv6 work, and remained hidden because it only gets triggered if a PID is reused quickly. And that is a rare event on Linux at least...

2014-Oct-10 17:15:21 by tannenba:
Code Review

Alan DeSmet did a code review (over ToddT's shoulder), and approves.
